channel.title: "Attention, Walmart customers: All black people, leave the store now."

item.title: "Attention, Walmart customers: All black people, leave the store now."
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:83, topic:333267”][quote author=Frell link=topic=429679.msg3163732#msg3163732 date=1269813355]

ive seen the interview of the white guy

hes a fucking nutjob

He was a nutjob and he still knew to go to the front of the bus and attempt to avoid a fight.
[/quote]

What the white guy did was pure self defence, although he did go slightly OTT.

I concur with both of these statements, but I don’t believe he went over the top – he responded to a physical threat with nothing more than his fists, and he merely put down the aggressor.

ive seen the interview of the white guy

hes a fucking nutjob

All the more reason for people to be on his side, and for the law to offer him adequate protection.[/quote]

Agree with all of this.

Read full topic

item.title: "Attention, Walmart customers: All black people, leave the store now."
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:89, topic:333267”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=429679.msg3188552#msg3188552 date=1272010039]
Anyone find it funny that if a black person was to announce “all white people leave the store”, I doubt anything would be done? I’m all for being equal and harmony between races, but if you’re equal you’re treated equal.
[/quote]

Oh, so you think that it’s fine to say something gas related to a jew, just because it’s fine to say the same to someone who isn’t a jew?[/quote]
That would be similar to mentioning the slave trade to a black person, not just telling them to leave the store.

item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I was watching t.v. the other day right got this white guy up there talking about black guys talking about how young black guys are targeted targeted by who? america you see one in every 100 americans are locked up one in every 9 black americans are locked up and see what the white guy was trying to stress was that the money we spend on sending a mothafucka to jail a young mothafucka to jail would be less to send his or her young ass to college see, and another thing the white guy was stressing was that our jails are populated with drug dealers, you know crack/cocaine stuff like that meaning due to the laws we have on crack/cocaine and regular cocaine police are only, i don't want to say only right, but shit only logic by riding around in the hood all day and not in the suburbs because crack cocaine is mostly found in the hood and you know the other thing is mostly found in you know where i'm going but why bring a mothafucka to jail if it's not gon stand up in court cuz this drug aint that drug, you know level 3, level 4 drug, shit like that i guess it's all a misunderstanding

item.title: "Attention, Walmart customers: All black people, leave the store now."
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Kozy, post:57, topic:333267”]As I have said, I have a few black friends. Believe it or not, there ARE Black’s that do something with there life. BUT, according to statistics, the MAJORITY of prisons are the Blacks, yet they are a MINORITY in America. It tells you something about most of there population. They are scum, who don’t mind going to jail. Infact, most of them go to jail, get out, and actually want to go right BACK in, because they have nothing else to live for, it’s like a game.

But, according to niggers, (as you said they don’t like there actual race name)white’s are racist! Sure, there are whites in jail, and in gangs, but statistics show that its a very minor amount. It’s human nature to shut out people who are unlike themselves; I hate hanging out with druggies.

Oh, and another thing… They call each other Nigger left and right… “Hey nigger, give me some of that my nigger!”; yet if you were to make one comment with “Nigger” in it, you would be in shit because you used a “racial slur”.[/quote]

Statistics just are numbers. They don’t reveal the underlying cause, which is exactly why you should dig deeper into the subject before calling black people scum.

Read full topic
item.source: "Attention, Walmart customers: All black people, leave the store now."

item.title: "Attention, Walmart customers: All black people, leave the store now."
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Kozy, post:70, topic:333267”][quote author=cooper link=topic=429679.msg3161384#msg3161384 date=1269571338]

@cooper: I don’t make assumptions there; the first sentences , about the minority/majority in prison, is true. “Scum, who don’t mind going to jail”, is an opinion, shared by many. The next sentence is true. My step-father is a CO1, at a prison, and most of there inmates who are in there, (Other then the few who are family men, who were in the wrong place at the wrong time, or did the wrong thing once), admit that they have nothing on the “outside”, and will be coming right back in after they make some money.

So, fuck your logic, I do have a point. Your point “dissipates”.

I meant assumptions for the later parts.
Them being “scum” is an opinion, yes, however stating that they don’t mind going to jail is not. Perhaps you have misinterpreted what I stated… I’ll rephrase it. You’re using inductive reasoning (going from specific examples to general statements). In this context, you’re saying that because the blacks that you/your stepfather have met in that situation have that desire, all [or most] blacks have that desire (I quote from you: “It tells you something about most of there [sic] population. They are scum, who don’t mind going to jail”). You then proceed to overgeneralize the situation with the next statement, (“Infact, most of them go to jail, get out, and actually want to go right BACK in, because they have nothing else to live for, it’s like a game.”) as well as oversimplify the situation. No, my point does not dissipate - in fact you only helped prove it more.
I am not attempting to directly change you or your opinions - I am merely critiquing you from a student of epistemology’s perspective, and hope that you will benefit from that.
[/quote]

What is epistemology? Also, most of them do that. They will tell you, that they plan on being back in there the next month.[/quote]And who’s to blame for that? Exactly, your stupid fucking society.

Read full topic
item.source: "Attention, Walmart customers: All black people, leave the store now."

item.description:

[quote=“cooper, post:69, topic:333267”][quote author=Kozy link=topic=429679.msg3161275#msg3161275 date=1269563935]
@cooper: I don’t make assumptions there; the first sentences , about the minority/majority in prison, is true. “Scum, who don’t mind going to jail”, is an opinion, shared by many. The next sentence is true. My step-father is a CO1, at a prison, and most of there inmates who are in there, (Other then the few who are family men, who were in the wrong place at the wrong time, or did the wrong thing once), admit that they have nothing on the “outside”, and will be coming right back in after they make some money.

So, fuck your logic, I do have a point. Your point “dissipates”.
[/quote]
I meant assumptions for the later parts.
Them being “scum” is an opinion, yes, however stating that they don’t mind going to jail is not. Perhaps you have misinterpreted what I stated… I’ll rephrase it. You’re using inductive reasoning (going from specific examples to general statements). In this context, you’re saying that because the blacks that you/your stepfather have met in that situation have that desire, all [or most] blacks have that desire (I quote from you: “It tells you something about most of there [sic] population. They are scum, who don’t mind going to jail”). You then proceed to overgeneralize the situation with the next statement, (“Infact, most of them go to jail, get out, and actually want to go right BACK in, because they have nothing else to live for, it’s like a game.”) as well as oversimplify the situation. No, my point does not dissipate - in fact you only helped prove it more.
I am not attempting to directly change you or your opinions - I am merely critiquing you from a student of epistemology’s perspective, and hope that you will benefit from that.[/quote]

What is epistemology? Also, most of them do that. They will tell you, that they plan on being back in there the next month.

item.title: "Attention, Walmart customers: All black people, leave the store now."
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Kozy, post:62, topic:333267”]@cooper: I don’t make assumptions there; the first sentences , about the minority/majority in prison, is true. “Scum, who don’t mind going to jail”, is an opinion, shared by many. The next sentence is true. My step-father is a CO1, at a prison, and most of there inmates who are in there, (Other then the few who are family men, who were in the wrong place at the wrong time, or did the wrong thing once), admit that they have nothing on the “outside”, and will be coming right back in after they make some money.

So, fuck your logic, I do have a point. Your point “dissipates”.[/quote]
I meant assumptions for the later parts.
Them being “scum” is an opinion, yes, however stating that they don’t mind going to jail is not. Perhaps you have misinterpreted what I stated… I’ll rephrase it. You’re using inductive reasoning (going from specific examples to general statements). In this context, you’re saying that because the blacks that you/your stepfather have met in that situation have that desire, all [or most] blacks have that desire (I quote from you: “It tells you something about most of there [sic] population. They are scum, who don’t mind going to jail”). You then proceed to overgeneralize the situation with the next statement, (“Infact, most of them go to jail, get out, and actually want to go right BACK in, because they have nothing else to live for, it’s like a game.”) as well as oversimplify the situation. No, my point does not dissipate - in fact you only helped prove it more.
I am not attempting to directly change you or your opinions - I am merely critiquing you from a student of epistemology’s perspective, and hope that you will benefit from that.

Read full topic
